context: Ryan coordinates early system preparation using provisional data, consolidates domain knowledge into shared documentation, and optimizes collaboration by shifting synchronous meetings to asynchronous review.

text.msg: ey dan, when you get a chance, could you send me the vertiport names, identifiers and a lat/lng for each ... as well as the direction of the flight. that will at least let me prep the system for when we have the schedules. I'm probably a little more in the dark than you suspect haha.
Do you mind if the codes are completely made up?

If that's okay, let's go with:
Departure Vertiport: Brisbane City East (VBCE) - -27.47287, 153.03177
Destination Vertiport: Brisbane Airport - International (VBAI) - -27.40280, 153.10811
I think that gives you the direction but if you want the general direction, it is North East.

Hey Dan, I'm combining and reorganizing our VAS knowledge into this doc if you have a moment to provide comments/additions/feedback: https://docs.google.com/document/d/15qQUwQyuqyJU9mTOcidaZMf3gw2vhnTf0LeX-FFQ_54/edit
For our meeting later, if you'd rather spend the time taking a look at the structure and content of said document, we can effectively "turn a meeting into an email" :)
That's a really good idea. Let's do that. üëç

For the record, a lot of the exposition/sections is free association... not necessarily formal work so feel free to just reword things if you're so inclined/inspired.
that's how you know its not chatgpt haha

internal.thought: I want to unblock system prep early, even with incomplete or provisional data.
Placeholder identifiers are totally fine as long as spatial relationships are correct.
Written artifacts scale better than meetings; offering async review respects time and improves clarity.
I explicitly lower the bar for polish so collaborators feel safe editing and contributing.
